dwolla.paymentPoweredBy: Echo Global Chemical Exchange payment gateway is powered by:
dwolla.thanksForJoining: Thank you for joining the Echo Marketplace.
dwolla.registrationProcess.description: This is the registration process for your company's payment method. For this process you will need to know some personal information about: your account administrator, your company beneficiaries (if applicable), and your company controller (i.e. Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Chief Operating Officer (COO), Chief Financial Officer (CFO), President, Controller, An executive officer or designated senior manager). If you need to gather information for any of the above person(s), you can exit this process and return at any time by clicking on 'Settings' and then 'Bank Accounts'. None of the personal information gathered will be stored; it is solely for identification authorization. Please see these links for more detailed information about the security of your data ({dwollaWhitePaper} & {dwollaSecurity}). If you have any questions or comments please contact Echo Support - email {email} or call {number}.
dwolla.beneficialOwnersDesc1: To help the government fight financial crime, Federal regulation requires our financial institution partners to obtain, verify, and record information about the beneficial owners of legal entity customers. Legal entities can be abused to disguise involvement in terrorist financing, money laundering, tax evasion, corruption, fraud, and other financial crimes. Requiring the disclosure of key individuals who ultimately own or control a legal entity (e.g. the beneficial owners) helps law enforcement investigate and prosecute these crimes.
dwolla.beneficialOwnersDesc2: The following information must be collected for each individual, if any, who, directly or indirectly, through any contract, arrangement, understanding, relationship or otherwise, owns 25 percent or more of the equity interests of the legal entity listed above. If no individual meets this definition or if the company is publicly traded, please check “Beneficial Owner Not Applicable” below and skip this section.
dwolla.controllerDesc1: To assure compliance with US financial institution policies, Echo must collect the information of at least one individual with significant responsibility for managing the legal entity listed above, such as:
dwolla.controllerDesc2: * An executive officer or senior manager (e.g., Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, Managing Member, General Partner, President, Vice President, Treasurer); or
dwolla.controllerDesc3: * Any other individual who regularly performs similar functions.
dwolla.acceptance: I, {name}, hereby certify, to the best of my knowledge, that the information provided above is complete and correct.
dwolla.registrationCompleteDesc1: Thanks for registering for your Dwolla Account. The verification process can take 24-48 hours. In the meantime you can add your Products, Warehouses, Branches, and other information in the Settings section of (web app name).
dwolla.registrationCompleteDesc2: Once Dwolla sends you the verification e-mail you can then add your Bank Accounts and Logisitics details. If you don’t receive a verification e-mail please contact support@echoexchange.net or call (833) 321 3246.
dwolla.info.none: You can start Dwolla account registration now.
dwolla.info.retry: Please retry Dwolla registration with all fields filled-in (not just required ones).
dwolla.info.document: Please verify you business by attaching following documents:
dwolla.document.verifycontrollerandbusin: to identify both Controlling person and Business
dwolla.document.explanatory.text1: A color scanned photo of the Controller’s identifying document can be specified as documentType: passport, license (state issued driver’s license), or idCard (other U.S. government-issued photo id card).
dwolla.document.explanatory.text21: Documents that are used to help identify a business are specified as documentType other. Business Identifying documents we recommend uploading can include the following:
dwolla.document.explanatory.TextLi13: One or more of the following, as applicable to your sole proprietorship: Fictitious Business Name Statement; Certificate of Assumed Name; Business License; Sales/Use Tax License; Registration of Trade Name; EIN documentation (IRS-issued SS4 confirmation letter); Color copy of a valid government-issued photo ID (e.g., a driver’s license, passport, or state ID card).
dwolla.document.explanatory.text22: Other business documents that are applicable includes any US government entity (federal, state, local) issued business formation or licensing exhibiting the name of the business enrolling with Dwolla, or; Any business formation documents exhibiting the name of the business entity in addition to being filed and stamped by a US government entity. Examples include:
dwolla.document.explanatory.li21: Filed and stamped Articles of Organization or Incorporation

addInventory.multipleLots: This value can not be edited as you have specified multiple lots.
addInventory.infoLabel: By clicking Save Mapping; CAS Name, CAS Number, Product Name and Product Number will be mapped in our system. Next time you enter this product these fields will be pre-populated for you.
addInventory.externalNotesTip: External notes are visible to other merchants.
addInventory.internalNotesTip: Internal notes are visible to you or other users of your company only.
addInventory.dragDrop: Drag and drop to add file here
addInventory.warning: Please enter allowed Split and Minimum values first.
addInventory.documents.name: Document Name
addInventory.fillToSearch: Please search product to fill data above.
addInventory.fixErrorsBeforeSubmit: There are errors on current tab. Please, fix them before submit.
addInventory.whatToList: What product do you want to list?
addInventory.enterProductInfo1: Enter product name or number from your product catalog for the product offer that you want to list. Once you do that, the data related to specified product will populate in the right hand column.
addInventory.enterProductInfo2: If you do not see the product that you want to list, then make sure in Settings/Product Catalog that the product exists and then return to this page.
addInventory.enterProductInfo3: Mapping a product from product catalog is required before entering a product offer.
addInventory.pickupDays: How many business days to pick up?
addInventory.pickupDays.description: Processing Time is the number of business days from when an order is confirmed that it will take you to have your product offer ready for pick up at your designated warehouse. NOTE: Saturdays and Sundays do not count for Processing Time.
addInventory.expirationDescription: If you would like to limit this pricing for a certain time period then enter the last date that you would like to make this offer available. After the date this product will not be available on the Marketplace until you adjust the date till into the future.
addInventory.shipFrom.header: Where will this product ship from?
addInventory.shipFrom.description: Warehouse is the physical location where your product offer will be picked up after an order is accepted. If you do not see the warehouse you need to list then go to Settings/Warehouses and add the information there. If you do not have permissions to add a new Warehouse then contact your company Admin.
addInventory.availablePackages.descripti: Total packages represents the number of drums, totes, super sacks etc that you will be listing for this product offer. Your packaging type and measurement for this product offer will populate on the right panel as soon as you select a product name/number.
addInventory.minimumOrderRequirement: Is there any order minimum requirement?
addInventory.minimumOrderRequirement.des: Minimum OQ is the minimum amount of packages you want to sell for any single order. If you want to sell no less than 10 drums for an order then enter 10. If you have no minimum order requirement then enter 1.
Splits is the multiples you are willing to accept for any single order. If you only want to sell multiples of 4 drums then enter 4. If you have no split requirements then enter 1.
addInventory.pricesCount: How many price tiers would you like to offer?
addInventory.pricesCount.description1: Price Tiers allow you to set different prices related to total quantities ordered for a single product offer.
addInventory.pricesCount.description2: For example if you list 40 drums you could set 2 tiers and offer orders of 1-20 drums at $1.00/lb and orders of 21-40 drums at $.90/lb.
addInventory.pricesCount.description3: If you only want to set only one price then enter '1'.
addInventory.fobPrice.header: What is the FOB price for each tier?
addInventory.fobPrice.description: FOB stands for free on board and freight on board and designates that the buyer is responsible for shipping costs. It also represents that ownership and liability is passed from seller to the buyer when the good are loaded at the originating location.
addInventory.uploadSpecSheet.description: The Spec Sheet, also known as a Technical Data Sheet (TDS), is required for a product offer to broadcast to the marketplace.
You can drag and drop a file from your computer or click on the box to search for the file as well.
IMPORTANT! Your company name and contact information cannot be listed on this document and non compliance is against Echo's Terms and Conditions.
addInventory.lotDetails.description: This is where you can track lot(s) that make up your product offer. For example if your product offer consists of three separate lots then hit the plus button to the right twice to add two more lots. Then enter the Lot # for each, the amount of packages that are associated to that lot within this product offer, the MFG date, the expiration date, and the associated Certificate of Analysis. This does not have to be completed when listing a product offer but it is required to designate lot info and CofA's within 48 hours of an order being shipped.
addInventory.packagesInLot.description: How many packages in this lot?
addInventory.unlinked: The file will be attached to Product Offer after you click the Save button
